pull.title: gui: Improve "Hide" button tool-tip message
pull.body:
Cleaned up the tool tip text, it looks as though it just got included back in 2014 when the whole section was added.

Changed hide button tool tip within transaction fee settings area from "collapse fee-settings" to "Hide transaction fee settings" to be more user friendly and fit with other tool tips.

![hide-transaction-fee-tool-tip](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17258195/68086415-b7b70680-fe43-11e9-82cb-567b9730c1b9.png)

rename.from: gui: cleaning up hide button tool tip

events.body:
Apologies, I hadn't realised that commit had snuck in, it's not something I've edited and assume it's come from something going wrong with the merge to my fork. I'm actually unsure how and the best way to squash this one, any advice on the best process?

Thanks!
Please also set a more detailed PR and commit title.
I admit that it's pretty hard to describe this particular tooltip message, but "hide button tool tip" implies that the commit *itself* is hiding something.

Just realised which title you are referring to, I'll get this updated later today.
Thanks

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.
